menu.title: Shiitake Mushroom Soup
menu.description: This is a vegetarian or vegan soup made with shiitake mushrooms as the main ingredient. It can be creamy or broth-based, and often includes other vegetables, herbs, and spices. Shiitake mushrooms have a rich, umami flavor that makes them a popular choice for soups.

ingredients.item: A packet of shitake mushrooms half mixed and half ground
Sufficient water according to the concentration of the soup
4 tablespoons of wheat flour mixed with a cup of water

instructions.step: Put the ground ingredients together, and put them in a pan or pot with a stem. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Add the flour mixture, mixed mushrooms, and other ingredients when it boils. Do not leave stirring until thickened
If it is not thick enough, add more flour mixture.
And it is ready to be served. Goodluck.

menu.title: Spaghetti Aglio Olio Shrimp
menu.description: This is a simple Italian pasta dish made with spaghetti, garlic, olive oil, and chili flakes. "Aglio e olio" translates to "garlic and oil" in Italian. The shrimp are typically cooked separately and added on top of the pasta for a protein boost. It's a quick and flavorful dish.

ingredients.item: Boiled 1 packet spaghetti and do not discard the boiled water

instructions.step: Fry the shrimp until cooked. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan as fried shrimp, saute garlic until fragrant.
Add aglio olio spices and stir-fry for a while.
Then add the spaghetti boiled water. Season with salt and anchovy powder.
Add broccoli, capsicum and mushroom. Close the pan for a moment.
When the vegetables are half cooked, add the spaghetti, cherry tomatoes, parsley, and shrimp that were fried earlier
Mix well. Ready to be served.

menu.title: Mac and cheese
menu.description: This classic comfort food is made with macaroni pasta and a cheese sauce. There are countless variations, but common cheeses used include cheddar, Gruyere, or Parmesan. It can be baked with a crispy topping or served creamy.

instructions.step: Saute the garlic until aromatic after melting the butter.
Stir in wheat flour until thickened.
Mix a little amount of full-cream milk and mix until well incorporated. When the cheese is added, mix it until it melts. If needed, add salt.
Add the macaroni and stir well.
Once it reaches a boil, turn off the heat. All set for serving.

menu.title: Pizza Express
menu.description: This is a British restaurant chain specializing in pizza. They offer a wide variety of pizzas with different toppings, crust styles, and sizes.

ingredients.item: A piece of frozen pizza dough

instructions.step: Turn the oven's heat to medium. Place the pizza base on the baking tray. After slicing the mushrooms, cover the pizza base with the bolognese sauce.
Top the mushrooms with the basil leaves after they have been arranged on the pizza base. Lastly, top with cheese (the more the better!). Place inside the oven.
Bake until the cheese turns a little golden. Cut it ready with a pizza cutter, so you can easily pull it out when you want to eat later. All set for serving.

menu.title: Halal Pho
menu.description: Pho is a traditional Vietnamese soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat. This Halal version of pho is both easy to make and healthy, offering a nutritious and delicious meal option.

ingredients.item: As many beef bones / chicken bones that you can lay your hands on
(Optional): A handful of cinnamon sticks and cloves if desired
Red poblano peppers, spring onions, lime and beansprouts to serve

instructions.step: Place the beef bones / chicken bones in a separate pot to the one you will use for your final Pho. Fleshy bits of bones will work best. Boil the bones for around 10 minutes to remove any impurities.
Dump the water in the sink, rinse the bones, and transfer them to a large, clean pot of boiling water (1.5-2 litres) in which you will make your Pho.
Using a pair of tongs, char the ginger and the onion over an open flame. Add the onion (unchopped), and the ginger to the Pho pot, along with the beef stock, salt, and fish sauce.

Simmer the broth on a low to medium heat. The longer you simmer the broth, the more flavours you’ll extract. (Traditional beef Pho takes anywhere between 4 to 12 hours, but here, 1.5 – 2 hours should suffice). Remove any foam/scum that floats to the top.
In a separate pot, add boiling water and a tablespoon of olive oil, and cook the noodles until they are soft.
In the last half an hour of your target soup-simmer time, add a handful of coriander and if desired, cinnamon sticks and cloves.

Cut the beef into thin, flat slices. You do not need to simmer them in the broth as they will cook through within seconds of coming into contact with the boiling Pho. (Simmering them in the soup for anything longer than thirty seconds will almost certainly result in tough, overcooked pieces of meat, which better resemble tyre shreddings than they do beef).
Plate up the noodles in separate bowls, and place the beef slices on top. Add slices of red poblano peppers, spring onions, lime and beansprouts, and any other vegetation that you desire.
Remove the bones and aromatics from the soup, and pour it into the bowls. Cover the beef slices / stir them around, and you’ll see that they will cook right through.
Finally – tuck in and enjoy a steamy, beefy, guilt-free broth!

menu.title: Gulab Jamun
menu.description: Gulab Jamun is a popular dessert in South Asia, particularly in India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. These delicious, soft, and spongy milk-solid-based sweets are soaked in rose-flavored sugar syrup, making them a delightful treat. This recipe is both easy to follow and relatively healthy, using simple ingredients that are halal-friendly.

ingredients.item: 2-3 tablespoons milk (as needed to form dough)
1 tablespoon rose water or a few drops of rose essence

instructions.step: In a large saucepan, combine sugar and water. Heat over medium flame, stirring occasionally until the sugar dissolves completely. Add the crushed cardamom pods and saffron strands (if using). Allow the syrup to boil for 5-7 minutes until it becomes slightly sticky. The syrup should not be too thick. Turn off the heat and add rose water or rose essence. Keep the syrup warm.

In a mixing bowl, combine milk powder, all-purpose flour, and baking soda. Add ghee or butter to the dry mixture and mix well. Gradually add milk, one tablespoon at a time, and knead gently to form a soft, smooth dough. The dough should not be too dry or too sticky. Let the dough rest for 5-10 minutes.

Divide the dough into small equal portions and roll them into smooth, crack-free balls. Heat oil or ghee in a deep frying pan over low-medium heat. Gently slide the balls into the hot oil, frying them in batches. The balls should rise slowly to the surface. If they rise too quickly, the oil is too hot. Fry the balls, gently stirring them to ensure even browning, until they turn golden brown. Remove the fried balls with a slotted spoon and drain the excess oil on paper towels.
While still warm, gently place the fried balls into the warm sugar syrup. Let the Gulab Jamun soak in the syrup for at least 1-2 hours. They will double in size as they absorb the syrup.

menu.title: Kung Pao Chicken
menu.description: Kung Pao Chicken, a beloved dish originating from the Sichuan province in China, is known for its spicy, savory, and slightly sweet flavors. This recipe is easy to make with simple ingredients and clear instructions, and it’s healthy with lean protein, fresh vegetables, and controlled sodium.

ingredients.item: 1 lb (450g) chicken breast, cut into small cubes
8-10 dried red chilies, deseeded and cut into halves
1 tablespoon Chinese black vinegar (or rice vinegar)

instructions.step: Marinate the Chicken
In a bowl, mix soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, cornstarch, and vegetable oil. Add the chicken cubes, mix well, and let marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Prepare the Sauce
In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, dark soy sauce, Chinese black vinegar, sugar, water, and cornstarch. Mix well and set aside.
Stir-fry the Chicken
Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken and stir-fry until about 70% cooked. Remove and set aside.
Cook the Aromatics

Clean the wok or skillet and heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add the dried red chilies and Sichuan peppercorns (if using). Stir-fry until aromatic. Add the minced garlic and sliced ginger, stir-frying briefly until fragrant.
Combine and Cook

Return the partially cooked chicken to the wok. Stir-fry briefly. Add the roasted peanuts and stir to combine. Pour in the prepared Kung Pao sauce, stirring continuously until the chicken is well-coated and the sauce thickens. Add the scallions, stirring to combine well with the chicken.
Serve
Dish out the Kung Pao Chicken and serve immediately with steamed rice.

menu.title: Okonomiyaki
menu.description: Okonomiyaki is a savory Japanese pancake that can be easily customized with various ingredients. This recipe is easy to prepare and offers a nutritious balance of vegetables and protein, making it a delightful and healthy meal option.

ingredients.item: ½ large head of cabbage (about 500g), finely chopped
½ cup (125ml) of dashi (Japanese soup stock)
1 small bunch of scallions/spring onions, sliced
150g of boneless chicken or seafood, cut into small pieces

instructions.step: To a large bowl, add the flour, salt, sugar, whisk together. Add the beaten eggs and dashi. Mix until just combined.
Add the chopped cabbage and sliced scallions and mix until combined.
Heat a frying pan over medium heat. Add some oil to lightly coat the bottom of the pan or use cooking spray.
When the frying pan is hot, ladle out nearly half the okonomiyaki batter onto the centre of the pan, then spread it out into a circle (the okonomiyaki should be roughly 2cm in thickness).

Place your chicken or seafood evenly on the pancake. Season lightly with some salt. Drizzle a bit more of the batter on the pancake over the meat/seafood (just to help it adhere and not fall out when you flip the pancake over).
Cover the pan and let it cook for about 5 minutes until the pancake is golden brown on the bottom.

Flip the pancake over - you can use two spatulas (each supporting half of the pancake), or you can also slide the okonomiyaki out onto a plate, then place your pan over your plate and flip the pancake back into the pan.
Cover again and let cook for another 5 minutes.

Flip the okonomiyaki one more time and let it cook for another couple of minutes. Check that the fillings are cooked and the pancake is cooked through (you can use a chopstick to poke through the centre of the pancake - if it comes out clean then it's ready.
Transfer the pancake to a plate. Repeat with the rest of the batter.
Drizzle over with okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise and bonito flakes. Serve immediately.

menu.title: Hummus
menu.description: Hummus is a creamy, rich, and flavorful dip that has become a beloved staple in many cuisines around the world. This traditional Middle Eastern dish, expertly crafted by renowned chef Yotam Ottolenghi, highlights the simple yet harmonious combination of chickpeas, tahini, lemon, and garlic

instructions.step: Place the chickpeas in a large bowl and cover with cold water. Leave to soak overnight.
Drain the chickpeas and place in a medium saucepan over high heat. Add the baking soda and cook for about 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add the water and bring to a boil. Cook for 20 to 40 minutes, skimming off any foam and skins that float to the surface.
Drain the chickpeas and place in a food processor. Process until you get a stiff paste.

With the machine running, add the tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Finally, slowly drizzle in the ice water and allow the food processor to run for about 5 minutes until you get a very smooth and creamy paste.
Transfer the hummus to a bowl, cover, and let it rest for at least 30 minutes. If not using right away, refrigerate until needed.
Serve with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of paprika.

menu.title: Falafel
menu.description: Falafel is a classic Middle Eastern dish beloved for its crispy texture and savory flavor. These golden-brown balls of ground chickpeas, herbs, and spices are a popular street food and a versatile component in vegetarian and vegan diets.

ingredients.item: Soybean or vegetable oil for frying

instructions.step: Put the chickpeas in a bowl and cover with cold water. Allow to soak overnight, then drain.
Place drained uncooked chickpeas, onions, parsley, cilantro, salt, hot pepper, garlic, and cumin in a food processor. Process until blended but not pureed.
Sprinkle in the baking powder and 4 tablespoons of the flour, and pulse. You want to add enough bulgur or flour so that the dough forms a small ball and no longer sticks to your hands.
Turn into a bowl and refrigerate, covered, for several hours
Form the chickpea mixture into balls about the size of walnuts, or use a falafel scoop, available in Middle Eastern markets.

Heat 3 inches of oil to 375°F in a deep pot or wok and fry 1 ball to test. If it falls apart, add a little flour. Then fry about six balls at once for a few minutes on each side, or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.

menu.title: Tabbouleh
menu.description: Tabbouleh is a refreshing and nutritious Middle Eastern salad that is perfect for warm weather or as a vibrant side dish to any meal. This salad, with its origins in Levantine cuisine, is known for its fresh ingredients and light, tangy flavor.

instructions.step: Place bulgur in a large bowl. Pour boiling water over it, cover, and let it sit for 15 minutes. Drain any excess water.
Add parsley, mint, tomatoes, cucumber, and green onions to the bulgur.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Pour over the salad and mix well.
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.

menu.title: Shakshuka
menu.description: Shakshuka is a vibrant and flavorful Middle Eastern dish that features poached eggs in a rich, spiced tomato and bell pepper sauce. Originating from North Africa, this popular dish is perfect for breakfast, brunch, or even a light dinner

ingredients.item: 1 can (28 ounces) whole peeled tomatoes, with juices

instructions.step: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and bell pepper, cook until soft.
Stir in garlic, cumin, paprika, and cayenne. Cook for 1 minute
Pour in the tomatoes, breaking them up with a spoon. Simmer until thickened, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Make wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each well. Cover and cook until the eggs are set, about 5 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve with crusty bread.
